segment.source: Planning Which Applications to Synchronize with UE-V 1.0
segment.target: Planning Which Applications to Synchronize with UE-V 1.0

segment.source: Planning Which Applications to Synchronize with UE-V 1.0
segment.target: Planning Which Applications to Synchronize with UE-V 1.0

segment.source: Planning Which Applications to Synchronize with UE-V 1.0
segment.target: Planning Which Applications to Synchronize with UE-V 1.0

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) uses settings location templates (XML files) that define the settings that are captured and applied by UE-V.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) uses settings location templates (XML files) that define the settings that are captured and applied by UE-V.

segment.source: UE-V includes a set of predefined settings location templates and also allows administrators to create custom settings location templates for third-party or line-of-business applications that are used in the enterprise.
segment.target: UE-V includes a set of predefined settings location templates and also allows administrators to create custom settings location templates for third-party or line-of-business applications that are used in the enterprise.

segment.source: As an administrator, when you consider which applications to include in your UE-V solution, consider which settings can be customized by users, and how and where the application stores its settings.
segment.target: As an administrator, when you consider which applications to include in your UE-V solution, consider which settings can be customized by users, and how and where the application stores its settings.

segment.source: Not all applications have settings that can be customized or that are routinely customized by users.
segment.target: Not all applications have settings that can be customized or that are routinely customized by users.

segment.source: In addition, not all applications settings can safely roam across multiple computers or environments.
segment.target: In addition, not all applications settings can safely roam across multiple computers or environments.

segment.source: Synchronize settings that meet the following criteria:
segment.target: Synchronize settings that meet the following criteria:

segment.source: Settings that are stored in user-accessible locations.
segment.target: Settings that are stored in user-accessible locations.

segment.source: For example, do not synchronize settings that are stored in system32 or outside HKCU section of the registry.
segment.target: For example, do not synchronize settings that are stored in system32 or outside HKCU section of the registry.

segment.source: Settings that are not specific to the particular computer.
segment.target: Settings that are not specific to the particular computer.

segment.source: For example, exclude network or hardware configurations.
segment.target: For example, exclude network or hardware configurations.

segment.source: Settings that can be synchronized between computers without risk of corrupted data.
segment.target: Settings that can be synchronized between computers without risk of corrupted data.

segment.source: For example, do not use settings that are stored in a database file.
segment.target: For example, do not use settings that are stored in a database file.

segment.source: Settings location templates that are included in UE-V
segment.target: Settings location templates that are included in UE-V

segment.source: UE-V application settings location templates
segment.target: UE-V application settings location templates

segment.source: The UE-V agent installation software installs the agent and registers a default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications.
segment.target: The UE-V agent installation software installs the agent and registers a default group of settings location templates for common Microsoft applications.

segment.source: These settings location templates capture settings values for the following applications:
segment.target: These settings location templates capture settings values for the following applications:

segment.source: Application category
segment.target: Application category

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft Office 2010 applications
segment.target: Microsoft Office 2010 applications

segment.source: Microsoft Word 2010
segment.target: Microsoft Word 2010

segment.source: Microsoft Excel 2010
segment.target: Microsoft Excel 2010

segment.source: Microsoft Outlook 2010
segment.target: Microsoft Outlook 2010

segment.source: Microsoft Access 2010
segment.target: Microsoft Access 2010

segment.source: Microsoft Project 2010
segment.target: Microsoft Project 2010

segment.source: Microsoft PowerPoint 2010
segment.target: Microsoft PowerPoint 2010

segment.source: Microsoft Publisher 2010
segment.target: Microsoft Publisher 2010

segment.source: Microsoft Visio 2010
segment.target: Microsoft Visio 2010

segment.source: Microsoft SharePoint Workspace 2010
segment.target: Microsoft SharePoint Workspace 2010

segment.source: Microsoft InfoPath 2010
segment.target: Microsoft InfoPath 2010

segment.source: Microsoft Lync 2010
segment.target: Microsoft Lync 2010

segment.source: Microsoft OneNote 2010
segment.target: Microsoft OneNote 2010

segment.source: Browser options (Internet Explorer 8, Internet Explorer 9, and Internet Explorer 10)
segment.target: Browser options (Internet Explorer 8, Internet Explorer 9, and Internet Explorer 10)

segment.source: Favorites, home page, tabs, and toolbars.
segment.target: Favorites, home page, tabs, and toolbars.

segment.source: Windows accessories
segment.target: Windows accessories

segment.source: Calculator, Notepad, WordPad.
segment.target: Calculator, Notepad, WordPad.

segment.source: Application settings are applied to the application when the application is started.
segment.target: Application settings are applied to the application when the application is started.

segment.source: They are saved when the application closes.
segment.target: They are saved when the application closes.

segment.source: UE-V Windows settings location templates
segment.target: UE-V Windows settings location templates

segment.source: User Experience Virtualization includes settings location templates that capture settings values for the following Windows settings:
segment.target: User Experience Virtualization includes settings location templates that capture settings values for the following Windows settings:

segment.source: Windows settings
segment.target: Windows settings

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Apply on
segment.target: Apply on

segment.source: Default state
segment.target: Default state

segment.source: Desktop background
segment.target: Desktop background

segment.source: Currently active desktop background.
segment.target: Currently active desktop background.

segment.source: Logon, unlock, remote connect.
segment.target: Logon, unlock, remote connect.

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: Ease of Access
segment.target: Ease of Access

segment.source: Accessibility and input settings, magnifier, Narrator, and on-Screen keyboard.
segment.target: Accessibility and input settings, magnifier, Narrator, and on-Screen keyboard.

segment.source: Logon, unlock, remote connect.
segment.target: Logon, unlock, remote connect.

segment.source: Disabled
segment.target: Disabled

segment.source: Desktop settings
segment.target: Desktop settings

segment.source: Start menu and Taskbar settings, Folder options, default desktop icons, additional clocks, and region and Language settings.
segment.target: Start menu and Taskbar settings, Folder options, default desktop icons, additional clocks, and region and Language settings.

segment.source: Logon only.
segment.target: Logon only.

segment.source: Disabled
segment.target: Disabled

segment.source: The Windows desktop background and Ease of Access settings are applied when the user logs on, when the computer is unlocked, or upon remote connection to another computer.
segment.target: The Windows desktop background and Ease of Access settings are applied when the user logs on, when the computer is unlocked, or upon remote connection to another computer.

segment.source: The agent saves these settings when the user logs off, when the computer is locked, or when a remote connection is disconnected.
segment.target: The agent saves these settings when the user logs off, when the computer is locked, or when a remote connection is disconnected.

segment.source: By default, Windows desktop background settings are roamed between computers of the same operating system version.
segment.target: By default, Windows desktop background settings are roamed between computers of the same operating system version.

segment.source: Windows desktop and Ease of Access settings are applied at logon before the desktop is presented to the user.
segment.target: Windows desktop and Ease of Access settings are applied at logon before the desktop is presented to the user.

segment.source: To optimize the logon experience, these settings are not roamed by default.
segment.target: To optimize the logon experience, these settings are not roamed by default.

segment.source: Desktop and Ease of Access settings can be enabled by using Group Policy, PowerShell, and WMI.
segment.target: Desktop and Ease of Access settings can be enabled by using Group Policy, PowerShell, and WMI.

segment.source: UE-V does not support the roaming of settings between operating systems with different languages.
segment.target: UE-V does not support the roaming of settings between operating systems with different languages.

segment.source: For example, synchronization between English and German is not supported.
segment.target: For example, synchronization between English and German is not supported.

segment.source: The language of all computers to which UE-V roams the user settings must match.
segment.target: The language of all computers to which UE-V roams the user settings must match.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you change the settings location templates that are provided by Microsoft, User Experience Virtualization might not work properly for the designated application or Windows settings group.
segment.target: If you change the settings location templates that are provided by Microsoft, User Experience Virtualization might not work properly for the designated application or Windows settings group.

segment.source: Prevent unintentional user Settings configuration
segment.target: Prevent unintentional user Settings configuration

segment.source: User Experience Virtualization checks for new user settings information, and downloads that information accordingly from a settings storage location.
segment.target: User Experience Virtualization checks for new user settings information, and downloads that information accordingly from a settings storage location.

segment.source: Then, it applies the settings to the local computer in the following cases:
segment.target: Then, it applies the settings to the local computer in the following cases:

segment.source: Every time an application is launched that has a registered UE-V template.
segment.target: Every time an application is launched that has a registered UE-V template.

segment.source: When a user logs on to their computer.
segment.target: When a user logs on to their computer.

segment.source: When a user unlocks their computer.
segment.target: When a user unlocks their computer.

segment.source: When a connection is made to a remote desktop computer that has UE-V installed.
segment.target: When a connection is made to a remote desktop computer that has UE-V installed.

segment.source: If UE-V is installed on computer A and computer B, and the desired settings for the application are on computer A, then computer A must open and close the application first.
segment.target: If UE-V is installed on computer A and computer B, and the desired settings for the application are on computer A, then computer A must open and close the application first.

segment.source: If an application is opened and closed on computer B first, then the application settings on computer A will be configured to be the same as the application settings on computer B.
segment.target: If an application is opened and closed on computer B first, then the application settings on computer A will be configured to be the same as the application settings on computer B.

segment.source: This scenario also applies to Windows settings.
segment.target: This scenario also applies to Windows settings.

segment.source: If the Windows settings on computer B should be the same as the Windows settings on computer A, then the user should logon and logoff computer A first.
segment.target: If the Windows settings on computer B should be the same as the Windows settings on computer A, then the user should logon and logoff computer A first.

segment.source: If the desired user settings are applied in the wrong order, they can be recovered by performing a restore operation for the specific application or Windows configuration on the computer on which the settings were overwritten.
segment.target: If the desired user settings are applied in the wrong order, they can be recovered by performing a restore operation for the specific application or Windows configuration on the computer on which the settings were overwritten.

segment.source: For more information, see Restoring Application and Windows Settings Synchronized with UE-V 1.0.
segment.target: For more information, see Restoring Application and Windows Settings Synchronized with UE-V 1.0.

segment.source: Custom UE-V settings location templates
segment.target: Custom UE-V settings location templates

segment.source: You can create custom settings location templates by using the UE-V Generator.
segment.target: You can create custom settings location templates by using the UE-V Generator.

segment.source: After you create and test a custom settings location template in a test environment, you can deploy the settings location templates to computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: After you create and test a custom settings location template in a test environment, you can deploy the settings location templates to computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: Custom settings location templates must be deployed with an existing deployment infrastructure, such as enterprise software distribution (ESD) method, with preferences, or by configuring an UE-V settings template catalog.
segment.target: Custom settings location templates must be deployed with an existing deployment infrastructure, such as enterprise software distribution (ESD) method, with preferences, or by configuring an UE-V settings template catalog.

segment.source: Templates that are deployed with ESD or Group Policy must be registered by using UE-V WMI or PowerShell.
segment.target: Templates that are deployed with ESD or Group Policy must be registered by using UE-V WMI or PowerShell.

segment.source: For more information about custom settings location templates, see Planning for Custom Template Deployment for UE-V 1.0.
segment.target: For more information about custom settings location templates, see Planning for Custom Template Deployment for UE-V 1.0.

segment.source: For guidance on whether a line-of-business application should be synchronized, see Checklist for Evaluating Line-of-Business Applications for UE-V 1.0.
segment.target: For guidance on whether a line-of-business application should be synchronized, see Checklist for Evaluating Line-of-Business Applications for UE-V 1.0.
